item.title: Flavors of bad code
item.description: There are many flavors of bad code but let us focus on two prominent ones named after tasty Italian dishes: spaghetti and lasagna. Spaghetti Spaghetti flavored code is unstructured code where everything is mixed in a single place. Usually it is produced by novices who are unaware on how to structure their code and tend to skip thinking about architecture. Typical reasons for spaghetti: Lack of experience. Not thinking about structuring code.
